body: Very Good shit man 👌, but I don't really like how they get caught in this one and separated in the next one, it's fiction so the author could of made anything happen so why something realistic and sad like that :(
Ir Jokowi yes mr president, always has been
The apple never falls far from the tree
Man I stopped caring about anything but plot - and I don't read normal manga much. I <3 this author.

@DBoayy The sequel chapters show further proof that their uncle and mom had a similar relationship. A short epilogue shows a flashback of them as kids in the same exact house. The way their uncle looks at the boy might also imply that he's the father, not just his uncle.
@nzxo Woah, that got deep pretty quickly. Thanks for telling us that, otherwise I (probably) wouldn't know even after re-reading it a few more times.

@dope-sensei Don't say that. If you have got in here, just accept incest-things, nomatter what it is. Yet, I think there should be more, like, "uncle's summer holiday" here. Because the problem of the incest, is, being known by others, but not if they are in-the-same-pool. Anyway, I realy like these kind of twists/stories which make me feel emo, not just instinc.

dope sensei

Seems like you don't mind incest at all, given your recent favorites and having read this doujin
@Dope sensei: just hear your heart.. i mean, 'hand' calling you what is right and dont try to fight it, just go with the flow~

@dope sensei : He didn't stop them because he felt guilty (or even hypocritical) because he 'was no better than them', implying that he had a sexual relationship with his sister (Chika; their mom. He makes it a point to ask about her in conversation, noting some kind of abnormal closeness). As the uncle wakes up from dozing off in the bath, he says 'I wish I had summer holidays again' upon hearing 'onii-chan'. His comment later saying "Disgusting...or it isn't?" kinda shows how he feels the inherent disgust but can't judge them because of the conflict he feels. 

I actually thought it was pretty well thought out and stands out compared to the story on most doujin... It's awfully minor and subtle, but there's even subtle hints of subterfuge like when the uncle asks if Naoki (the brother) went with her. There's not a whole lot of reason to waste page space to point these sorts of things out if they're not important, you know?
